title: Ohm's Law Verification
subject: physics
description: Verify the relationship between voltage, current, and resistance using a simple circuit.

steps.title: Set up the circuit
steps.description: Connect the battery, ammeter, resistor, and voltmeter in the circuit as shown in the diagram.

steps.title: Adjust the voltage
steps.description: Use the voltage slider to set different voltage values and observe the current changes.

steps.title: Record observations
steps.description: Note down the voltage (V) and current (I) readings for at least 5 different settings.

steps.title: Calculate resistance
steps.description: For each reading, calculate R = V/I and verify it matches the set resistance value.

steps.title: Plot the graph
steps.description: Plot V vs I on graph paper. The slope gives the resistance value.

steps.title: Draw conclusions
steps.description: Verify that V ∝ I (voltage is directly proportional to current) for a constant resistance.

title: Simple Pendulum
subject: physics
description: Study the time period of a simple pendulum and verify T = 2π√(L/g).
objectives: Measure time period for different lengths

steps.title: Set up the pendulum
steps.description: Attach the bob to the thread and clamp it to the stand. Measure the effective length (L).

steps.title: Displace the bob
steps.description: Pull the bob slightly to one side (small angle) and release it to oscillate.

steps.title: Measure time
steps.description: Use a stopwatch to measure the time for 10 or 20 complete oscillations.

steps.title: Calculate Time Period
steps.description: Divide total time by number of oscillations to get Time Period (T).

steps.title: Repeat
steps.description: Repeat the experiment for different lengths of the pendulum.

steps.title: Plot Graph
steps.description: Plot L vs T² graph to find the value of g.

title: Acid-Base Titration
subject: chemistry
description: Determine the concentration of an unknown acid using a standard base solution.

steps.title: Fill the Burette
steps.description: Clean and fill the burette with the standard base solution (NaOH). Note initial reading.

steps.title: Prepare Analyte
steps.description: Pipette a known volume of acid (HCl) into a conical flask.

steps.title: Add Indicator
steps.description: Add 2-3 drops of phenolphthalein indicator to the acid.

steps.title: Titrate
steps.description: Slowly add base from burette to flask with swirling until a faint pink color persists.

steps.title: Record Reading
steps.description: Note the final burette reading. Calculate volume of base used.

steps.title: Calculate
steps.description: Use M1V1 = M2V2 to calculate the molarity of the acid.

title: pH Testing of Solutions
subject: chemistry
description: Test and classify various solutions as acidic, basic, or neutral using pH indicators.

steps.title: Prepare samples
steps.description: Take small amounts of different solutions in separate test tubes.

steps.title: Test with pH paper
steps.description: Dip a strip of pH paper into each solution and observe the color change.

steps.title: Compare with chart
steps.description: Match the color with the standard pH color chart to determine pH value.

steps.title: Classify
steps.description: Classify as acidic (pH < 7), neutral (pH = 7), or basic (pH > 7).

title: Microscope Cell Observation
subject: biology
description: Observe plant and animal cells under a microscope and identify key structures.

steps.title: Prepare Onion Slide
steps.description: Peel a thin layer of onion epidermis, stain with iodine, and cover with a cover slip.

steps.title: Observe Onion Cells
steps.description: Place slide on stage, focus under low power, then high power. Look for cell wall.

steps.title: Prepare Cheek Slide
steps.description: Gently scrape inside cheek, smear on slide, stain with methylene blue.

steps.title: Observe Cheek Cells
steps.description: Focus and observe irregular shapes and nucleus. Note absence of cell wall.

title: Photosynthesis Experiment
subject: biology
description: Demonstrate oxygen production during photosynthesis using aquatic plants.

steps.title: Set up apparatus
steps.description: Place aquatic plant in a beaker with water and NaHCO3. Invert funnel over it.

steps.title: Collect gas
steps.description: Invert a water-filled test tube over the funnel stem.

steps.title: Expose to light
steps.description: Place the setup in sunlight or strong artificial light.

steps.title: Observe bubbles
steps.description: Observe gas bubbles rising from the plant, displacing water in the test tube.

steps.title: Test gas
steps.description: Test the collected gas with a glowing splint (it should relight, indicating Oxygen).

title: Projectile Motion
subject: physics
description: Study the motion of projectiles and analyze trajectory, range, maximum height, and time of flight.
objectives: Analyze the effect of launch angle on range
Calculate maximum height and time of flight

steps.title: Setup Launcher
steps.description: Clamp the projectile launcher to the table edge and adjust angle.

steps.title: Launch Projectile
steps.description: Place ball in launcher and fire. Ensure safety area is clear.

steps.title: Measure Range
steps.description: Mark the landing point and measure horizontal distance from launch point.

steps.title: Vary Angle
steps.description: Change angle by 15 degrees steps and repeat launch to compare ranges.

steps.title: Record Data
steps.description: Record angle, range, and time of flight for each trial.
